title.narrative: OUTPUT 5.3 FIELD OPERATIONS AND EMERGENCIES

description.narrative: Output 5.3 Field Operations And Emergencies, which contributes to Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral - Planning And Programme Reviews, Cross-Sectoral - Planning And Programme Reviews (Covid), Operations Support To Programme Delivery, Reducing Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 5. Program Effectiveness

mailing-address.narrative: Plot 9 George Street PO Box 7047 Kampala

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 5.3 Field Operations And Emergencies

description.narrative: Given the multiple risks facing Uganda, including mass population movements, disease outbreaks, and climate hazards, UNICEF’s prioritization of emergency preparedness at national and sub-national levels proved crucial in 2021. The emergency preparedness and response capacity building initiative provided an opportunity for UNICEF to work with the Office of the Prime Minister (OPM) in placing analysis and preparedness for localized risks at the forefront of its programming.The establishment of data-driven mechanisms to support; risk-responsive programme monitoring and assurance at zonal office level was a key milestone in Management’s strategic move to decentralize budget and partnership management to zonal offices. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:10/01/2022
